tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE energy_consumption_data (
    meter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    consumption DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE meter_locations (
    meter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    city VARCHAR,
    address VARCHAR,
    latitude DECIMAL,
    longitude DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE meter_readings (
    reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT,
    date DATE,
    time TIME,
    reading DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE energy_consumption_data (
    meter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE,
    time TIME,
    energy_usage FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE meter_details (
    meter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR,
    installation_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE meter_readings (
    reading_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT REFERENCES meter_details(meter_id),
    reading_date TIMESTAMP,
    reading FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE meter_errors (
    error_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT REFERENCES meter_details(meter_id),
    error_type VARCHAR,
    error_description VARCHAR
)

CREATE TABLE smart_meters (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT,
    date TIMESTAMP,
    time TIME,
    consumption DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE meter_readings (
    reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT,
    date TIMESTAMP,
    time TIME,
    reading DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE analyzed_consumption (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT,
    analysis_date DATE,
    peak_time TIME,
    peak_consumption DECIMAL
);
